pull.title: [Wallet] [RPC] Remove deprecated wallet rpc features from bitcoin_server
pull.body:
The following rpc features were deprecated in V0.17:

- `validateaddress` returning wallet information about an address
- `signrawtransaction`

This PR fully removes those features. It can be merged once V0.17 has been branched from master.

events.body:
open-closing this PR so the branch is available to everyone. This ~+ #10762~ should allow server to be built without any dependencies on wallet.

Will re-open once V0.17 has been branched.

Edit: #10762 has been merged. I've now rebased this on master.

rename.from: Remove deprecated wallet rpc methods from server
rename.to: Remove deprecated wallet rpc features from bitcoin_server

issue.title: Remaining instances of ENABLE_WALLET in `libbitcoin_server.a`
issue.body:
We've been quite successful in eliminating these lately (#7905, #7691). 

It would be nice to disentangle the wallet and non-wallet initialization completely so that init.cpp no longer depends on the wallet (and thus, `libbitcoin_server.a` no longer depends on `libbitcoin_wallet.a` - the other way is fine, a circular dependency is not).

Ignoring the GUI for now (which still needs some work in this direction), the following are left:
- `init.cpp`: these are mostly self-contained and short. (#10762)
  - [x] print BerkeleyDB version should probably be moved to ~~`CWallet::InitLoadWallet`~~ `CWallet::Verify` (fixed in #8036).
  - [x] wallet-specfic option interaction (`-walletbroadcast`, `-prune`+`-rescan`) should move to wallet module (possibly a new call that can be called in addition to `InitParameterInteraction()`)
  - [x] printing setKeyPool size etc should probably be moved to `CWallet::InitLoadWallet`.
  - [x] wallet initialization/verify/shutdown - maybe this could be replaced by a general registration system for initialization/interrupt/shutdown functions, called as signals in the appropriate places. The same could be used by other modules
  - [x] `-disablewallet` could result in the wallet not being registered at all, and that can all be handled from outside init.
- RPC still has some calls that vary depending on wallet support. We should split these up. This is the more annoying part as it will involve API changes. No non-wallet RPC call should make an assumption about "a wallet".
  - `rpcmisc.cpp`
    - [x] `getinfo` - this call is already on the list to be deprecated for a long time (#10838)
    - [x] `validateaddress` - should be split up into an utility-only `validateaddress` and a wallet-specific call `getaddressinfo` (name open for discussion) (#10583)
    - [x] `createmultisig` - same. `createmultisig` and `walletcreatemultisig` or so (#11415)
  - [x] `rpcblockchain.cpp`
    - [x] `signrawtransaction` - should be split into an utility-only `signrawtransaction` and a wallet-specific call `walletsignrawtransaction` (#10579)
  - [x] remove deprecated `validateaddress` and `signrawtransaction` wallet dependency completely (#12490)
- [x] Mining: no `ENABLE_WALLET` but an implicit assumption and a circuitous registration system. The `generate` call should be a wallet-specific call, whereas `generatetoaddress` is core. See discussion in #6481. (done in #10683).
- [x] in `httprpc.cpp`, there are #ifdef ENABLE_WALLETs protecting registration/unregistration of the wallet endpoint. These can trivially be replaced with calls into the WalletInitInterface.
- [x] in `interfaces/node.cpp`, #ifdef ENABLE_WALLET protects the calls to getWallets(). This can easily be replaced by calls into a wallet manager/dummy wallet manager.

The first phase would be to introduce the new (wallet-only) methods, then a release later remove wallet functionality from the core-only calls.

issue.title: [PoC] Add wallet inspection and modification tool "bitcoin-wallet-tool"
issue.body:
**WORK IN PROGRESS**
Add another bitcoin-tool called `bitcoin-wallet-tool`. Currently it supports creation of wallets (with optional encryption before creating keys), encryption and some info-dumping.

If we agree on this concept, it could be use for creating a HD wallet with a given xpriv.
Also, a such tool would probably be required to properly restore a hd wallet.
If we once migrate away from BerkleyDB, this could also be helpful.

issue.title: [RPC] Split signrawtransaction into multiple distinct RPCs
issue.body:
The current signrawtransaction rpc command is kind of a mess. It contains both wallet code and non-wallet code as well as an undocumented feature to combine multiple transactions. This issue is to track progress on this and to get some commentary on this split.

The goal of this is to result in the following (and probably in this order):
- [x] Split combination of transactions into a new RPC that also handles the combination (#10571)
- [x] Split `signrawtransaction` into wallet and non-wallet RPCs. (#10579)
- [x] Mark `signrawtransaction` as deprecated (#10579)
- [x] Remove `signrawtransaction` (#12490)

issue.title: [wallet] Kill accounts
issue.body:
To make space for new words, it's time to eliminate a word that has fallen into disuse: accounts. We make it fade into the night of time.

RIP accounts.

Completes #12952

issue.title: [Tools] bitcoin-wallet - a tool for creating and managing wallets offline
issue.body:
Adds an offline tool `bitcoin-wallet-tool` for wallet creation and maintenance.

Currently this tool can create a new wallet file and display information on an existing wallet. It can later be extended to support other common wallet maintenance tasks (eg run the salvage and zapwallettxes maintenance tasks on an existing wallet).

Doing wallet maintenance tasks in an offline tool makes much more sense (and is potentially safer) than having to spin up a full node.

issue.title: Refactoring CRPCCommand with enum category
issue.body:
refactoring `CRPCCommand` changing the  type of its member `category` from `std::string` to a `typedef enum ERPCCategory`.
The behaviour should be exactly the same with a very very small, in any way irrelevant, speed dump.

I am doing this, in preparation to add attributes, likes `visibility` and `state` to `CRPCCommand ` structure, to avoid using category names, for overridden informations like visibility or deprecation.

For example, from v0.16.0 the command `getinfo` switched its category from `control` to `hidden`, while I think the idea was to let it to `control` category, with attributes similar to `visibility = false` and `state = deprecated`

Thanks,
Isidoro Ghezzi

p.s:
* Take care on the fact, that I had no warning assigning the enum to a std::string :-(
Also take care I'm never testing on QT. (I simply never configure nor compile on QT); anyway I was able to catch the QT command `rpcNestedTest`.
* I tested only on `regtest` and `macOS`

EDITs: 
 1. Using `enum class` it's giving right error trying to assign by mistake to a std::string :-) https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13945/commits/cf190f57a078df1d37bd1822e3fa69ba0d9c90e6
2. I tested on `regtest` on `ubuntu` and `macOS`
3. I never tested nor compiled on windows.

events.body: V0.17 has been branched. This is ready for review/merge

issue.title: Remove accounts rpcs
issue.body:
This is the first part of #13825. It simply removes the RPC methods and tests.

#13825 touches lots of files and will require frequent rebasing.

Breaking it down for easier reviewing and fewer rebases.

events.message:
[RPC] Remove warning about wallet addresses in createmultisig()

createmultisig() was updated in V0.16 to not use the wallet. Warning
text was included to warn the user. Remove that now.

events.body: What was the reasoning behind this? It seems unnecessary.

@ptyx11 This is part of the separation of the wallet from the node. Those RPCs were node RPCs which involved wallet things, so they needed to be removed. They have been deprecated for at least one major version with replacement RPCs already available.

issue.title: Deprecated signrawtransaction
issue.body:
`signrawtransaction` has been deprecated. 

We're currently passing `-deprecatedrpc=signrawtransaction` to bitcoind, but the rpc will probably be [removed in the next release of Bitcoin Core](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12490).

https://github.com/poetapp/node/blob/b71115ac4ffd877efa338885cba91c040ccb58bf/docker-compose.yml#L31-L43

We should be able to update our code base to use [`signrawtransactionwithwallet`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10579) instead — the diff in the PR shows the tests being updated to use this new RPC with no changes to the arguments.

See https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/10570.

@geoffturk adding this to mainnet-launch since it's not breaking right now, but the breaking change was already merged to master so we'll want to start work on this one as soon as we finish mainnet-beta.

issue.title: [rpc] Remove the addresses field from the getaddressinfo return object
issue.body:
The "addresses" field was confusing because it refered to public keys
using their P2PKH address.  It was included in the return object when
needed for backward compatibility. Remove that compatibility now that
the -deprecatedrpc=validateaddress option has been removed.

New applications should use the 'embedded'->'address' field for P2SH or
P2WSH wrapped addresses, and 'pubkeys' for inspecting multisig
participants.

comments.body: nit: No need for double semicolon?
